projectPurpose: To provide a modern, open-source package registry specifically designed for the contemporary JavaScript and TypeScript ecosystem, addressing shortcomings of existing registries by offering features like native TypeScript support, mandatory ESM, improved security, and better developer experience across different JavaScript runtimes and package managers.
platforms: Packages usable by various JS runtimes and package managers
mainFeatures: Native TypeScript support (publish source directly, auto-docs)
Cross-runtime compatibility (Deno, Node.js, Bun, Cloudflare Workers, etc.)
Interoperability with npm and npm-compatible package managers (Yarn, pnpm)

alternatives.name: npm Registry (npmjs.org)
alternatives.license: Public registry is free to use (CLI is typically ISC)
platforms: Packages usable by Node.js and compatible tools
mainFeatures: World's largest software registry for JavaScript
Supports granular access tokens for publishing

alternatives.name: pnpm
mainFeatures: Compatible with the npm registry and JSR

alternatives.name: GitHub Package Registry
mainFeatures: Hosts packages alongside code on GitHub

alternatives.name: Verdaccio
mainFeatures: Works with npm, Yarn, and pnpm clients

marketPositioning: JSR positions itself as a modern, TypeScript-first, and runtime-agnostic package registry designed to enhance the JavaScript ecosystem. Unlike the dominant npm registry, JSR natively supports TypeScript source publishing, enforces ESM, and offers enhanced security and quality features. Its key differentiator is its focus on the evolving needs of modern JavaScript and TypeScript development across diverse runtimes, while ensuring interoperability with existing npm-based workflows and package managers like Yarn and pnpm. JSR aims to be a forward-thinking alternative and complement to the traditional npm registry.
